meta.title: Cumulative Exam on 13th July (The Champion Batch Hyderabad) - 13-07-2024 - 2024-07-13

questions.text: A 28-year-old male presents with unilateral, clear, watery nasal discharge that increases on bending forward and cannot be sniffed back. He recently sustained a head injury. Which of the following tests would most reliably confirm the diagnosis?

After sustaining a head injury, an 18-month-old child displays eye opening only to pain, moans on painful stimuli and withdraws to painful stimuli. What is the modified Glasgow Coma Scale Score in this child?
Match the following:
A 40-year-old male presents with symptoms of chronic sinusitis. A Waters view (shown in the image) is performed. Which sinus is best visualized with this radiographic technique?

A 50-year-old female presents with hearing loss and pulsatile tinnitus. On examination, a red reflex is seen through the intact tympanic membrane. Pressure applied to the ear canal causes the tumor to pulsate and blanch. Which of the following is the most likely diagnosis?
Identify the pathology in the newborn baby as shown in the image below?
The sodium iodide symporter is present in all of the following except?

If the ICF concentration of K is 140 mEq/L and ECF concentration is 14 mEq/L and cell is permeable only to K+, what would be the effect of reducing the extracellular K + concentration from 14 to 1.4 millimolar?
Which of the following vaccine are stored under the top rack compartment of the domestic refrigerator?
An adult male is presented with duodenal ulcer is offered various surgical options for its treatment. Which of the surgical options listed below causes least complications?
A healthcare worker experiences a needlestick injury and is concerned about the risk of HIV infection. Post-exposure prophylaxis (PEP) against HIV infection should not be delayed beyond:

A 32-year-old male glassblower presents with a progressively enlarging neck mass and hoarseness of voice. On examination, the mass is found to be soft and compressible. Which of the following conditions is most likely responsible for his symptoms?

A 34-year-old female singer presents with hoarseness and difficulty in hitting high notes. Laryngoscopy reveals bowed vocal cords with no lesions. Which of the following muscles is most likely involved in her symptoms?
Which of the following is not a sign of good attachment in breast feeding?

options.label: B
options.text: Mouth wide open with fullness of cheeks

options.label: C
options.text: Baby’s upper lip is everted out

options.label: D
options.text: Mother’s upper areola is exposed out

questions.correct_answer: C. Baby’s upper lip is everted out
questions.explanation: Ans. C) Baby’s upper lip is everted out

questions.text: A 50-year-old dairy quality control manager is reviewing tests used to assess the pasteurization process of milk. Which of the following tests is NOT typically used to evaluate pasteurization of milk?
A 45-year-old male who has been on treatment for varicose veins for the past 4 years, presents with eczema over the limb. What C stage does he belong to?

A 10-year-old boy presents with recurrent nosebleeds. On examination, there is evidence of bleeding from the anterior inferior part of the nasal septum. Which of the following vascular structures is most likely involved?
A hospital infection control team is selecting chemicals for disinfecting different biomedical components. Which of the following chemicals is used as a disinfectant for blood spills?

A five-year-old child presented with acute watery diarrhea and crampy pain in the abdomen. Stool examination was done which showed trophozoites with falling leaf motility. What is the most likely pathogen?

A 23-year-old hypertensive man comes to the hospital, on examination, BP was 150/90 mmHg, and was afebrile. On further evaluation, serum renin was found to be normal. He was diagnosed with Conn’s Syndrome. All are true about the Conn’s Syndrome except:

A 35-year-old female presents with progressive hearing loss and reports that she hears better in noisy environments. On examination, her tympanic membranes are intact, but a reddish hue is noted on the promontory. Which of the following is the most likely diagnosis?

A 25-year-old female presents with frequent sneezing, watery nasal discharge, nasal obstruction, and itching. Physical examination reveals a transverse nasal crease and dark circles under the eyes. Which of the following laboratory findings is most likely to support the diagnosis?

options.label: A
options.text: Elevated absolute eosinophil count and serum IgE levels

questions.correct_answer: A. Elevated absolute eosinophil count and serum IgE levels
questions.explanation: Ans. A) Elevated absolute eosinophil count and serum IgE levels

questions.text: Which virus's life cycle is represented in the image?
Which disease is transmitted by the vector shown in the image ?

A 70-year-old male had surgery for a ruptured sigmoid colon diverticulum with an abscess. A repair was done and the abscess was drained. He was treated with IV Gentamicin & Ampicillin. 10 days later, he had multiple episodes of diarrhea, his stool was positive for occult blood and the presence of polymorphonuclear cells. On sigmoidoscopy the mucosa is erythematous and inflamed and there were many raised white to yellowish plaques. What is the diagnosis?
A researcher is analyzing the progression of a disease from its onset to its potential outcomes. The image shown illustrates the stages a patient might go through. What does this image represent?
An infant was born at 30 weeks of gestation and weighs 1.2 kg at birth. Which of the following is the recommended initial feeding method?
A 6-year-old boy presents with multiple itchy papular lesions on his genitalia and fingers. His younger brother has similar lesions. What is the most likely diagnosis?
A chest X-ray of a patient with left-sided heart failure indicates pulmonary edema. Additional examination probably would reveal which of the following?

In a vascular research lab, an experiment is conducted to study the effects of vessel diameter and length on blood flow rates. Two artificial vessels, A and B, are set up for comparison. Vessel A has a diameter of 2D and a length of 2L, whereas vessel B has a diameter of D and a length of L. Calculate the flow rate of vessel A relative to vessel B.

options.label: A
options.text: The flow rate in vessel A is 4 times that of vessel B.

options.label: B
options.text: The flow rate in vessel A is 8 times that of vessel B.

options.label: C
options.text: The flow rate in vessel A is 16 times that of vessel B.

options.label: D
options.text: The flow rate in vessel A is 32 times that of vessel B.

questions.correct_answer: B. The flow rate in vessel A is 8 times that of vessel B.
questions.explanation: Ans. B) The flow rate in vessel A is 8 times that of vessel B.

questions.text: A newborn presents with difficulty breathing and feeding. Examination reveals mucoid nasal discharge and an inability to pass a catheter through one of the nostrils into the pharynx. What is the most likely diagnosis?
A chronic smoker gets cramping pain in his calf after walking about 500 m. What is the likely pathology?
Identify the hormone secreted by the zone of adrenal cortex shown by the arrow:
questions.explanation:
Ans. D) Androgens

Explanation:

  • • Explanation:
  • • The image represents the adrenal cortex with its three layers, and the arrow is pointing to the innermost layer , which is the zona reticularis .
  • • adrenal cortex
  • • innermost layer
  • • zona reticularis
  • • The adrenal cortex is divided into three distinct zones:
  • • adrenal cortex
  • • Zona Glomerulosa (Outer layer) → Secretes Mineralocorticoids (Aldosterone) Zona Fasciculata (Middle layer) → Secretes Glucocorticoids (Cortisol, Corticosterone) Zona Reticularis (Inner layer) → Secretes Androgens (DHEA, Androstenedione)
  • • Zona Glomerulosa (Outer layer) → Secretes Mineralocorticoids (Aldosterone)
  • • Zona Glomerulosa
  • • Secretes Mineralocorticoids (Aldosterone)
  • • Zona Fasciculata (Middle layer) → Secretes Glucocorticoids (Cortisol, Corticosterone)
  • • Zona Fasciculata
  • • Secretes Glucocorticoids (Cortisol, Corticosterone)
  • • Zona Reticularis (Inner layer) → Secretes Androgens (DHEA, Androstenedione)
  • • Zona Reticularis
  • • Secretes Androgens (DHEA, Androstenedione)
  • • Since the arrow is pointing to the zona reticularis , it primarily produces androgens , which can be converted into testosterone and estrogen in peripheral tissues.
  • • zona reticularis
  • • androgens
  • • testosterone and estrogen
  • • Other Options:
  • • Other Options:
  • • Option A. Glucocorticoid → Secreted by the zona fasciculata , not the zona reticularis.
  • • Option A. Glucocorticoid
  • • zona fasciculata
  • • Option B. Mineralocorticoid → Secreted by the zona glomerulosa , which is the outermost layer.
  • • Option B. Mineralocorticoid
  • • zona glomerulosa
  • • Option C. Adrenaline → Secreted by the adrenal medulla , not the cortex.
  • • Option C. Adrenaline
  • • adrenal medulla

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ The adrenal cortex follows the GFR mnemonic (Glomerulosa - Fasciculata - Reticularis), where each layer secretes specific hormones:
  • ➤ adrenal cortex
  • ➤ GFR mnemonic
  • ➤ G → Mineralocorticoids (Aldosterone) F → Glucocorticoids (Cortisol, Corticosterone) R → Androgens (DHEA, Androstenedione)
  • ➤ G → Mineralocorticoids (Aldosterone)
  • ➤ G → Mineralocorticoids (Aldosterone)
  • ➤ F → Glucocorticoids (Cortisol, Corticosterone)
  • ➤ F → Glucocorticoids (Cortisol, Corticosterone)
  • ➤ R → Androgens (DHEA, Androstenedione)
  • ➤ R → Androgens (DHEA, Androstenedione)

questions.text: What is not true regarding renal stones?

options.label: A
options.text: Most common type of stone is triple phosphate

options.label: B
options.text: Small stones can be managed conservatively with pharmacotherapy

options.label: C
options.text: Soft stones can be removed by ESWL

options.label: D
options.text: ESWL should not be performed in pregnancy

questions.correct_answer: A. Most common type of stone is triple phosphate
questions.explanation: Ans. A) Most common type of stone is triple phosphate

questions.text: A 68-year-old female with a history of mitral stenosis is undergoing a cardiac catheterization to assess her cardiac pressures and function. The cardiologist points out various phases of the cardiac cycle on the pressure tracing obtained during the procedure. Based on the pressure-time graph provided, at which point does ventricular filling begin?

options.label: A
options.text: Point A, where the pressure in the left atrium begins to rise.

options.label: B
options.text: Point B, at the peak of the pressure-time curve.

options.label: C
options.text: Point C, as the aortic pressure begins to fall.

options.label: D
options.text: Point D, marking the return to baseline of left ventricular pressure.

questions.correct_answer: D. Point D, marking the return to baseline of left ventricular pressure.
questions.explanation: Ans. D) Point D, marking the return to baseline of left ventricular pressure.

questions.text: A 52-year-old patient with a history of chronic alcohol abuse presents to the clinic with complaints of lesion in the mouth. A picture of the patient's oral cavity is provided, which reveals several white patches on the tongue and inner cheek which cant be rubbed off. Based on this presentation, what is the likely diagnosis and next step for this patient?
All of the following are seen in henonch schonlein purpura except?
questions.correct_answer: B. Palpable purpura in upper limbs
questions.explanation: Ans. B) Palpable purpura in upper limbs

questions.text: Which of the following items and their sterilization methods are NOT properly matched?
What should be the next step in a patient who presented in the emergency with respiratory distress, dilated neck veins and hyper-resonance on percussion?

options.label: A
options.text: Wide bore needle insertion in 5th intercostal space

questions.correct_answer: A. Wide bore needle insertion in 5th intercostal space
questions.explanation: Ans. A) Wide bore needle insertion in 5th intercostal space

questions.text: Which of the following would help in explaining the mechanism of action of atrial natriuretic peptide?
A child was able to sit without support has now developed stranger anxiety. At what age does a baby develop stranger anxiety?

A 65-year-old male came with a history of progressive dysphagia, initially to solid foods and now to liquids too. He has also experienced significant weight loss over the past few months. Which of the following is the investigation of choice for diagnosing the underlying cause of his symptoms?
Which of the following physiological condition is generally not observed at high altitudes?
A 4-year-old child came with complaints of loose stool. On further examination child’s mid upper arm circumference was 11.4 cm. He was planned to give RESOMAL. How much is sodium in RESOMAL?

In a patient with a rare genetic disorder affecting cellular transport, dysfunction of a specific protein clathrin is suspected. What cellular process, crucial for nutrient uptake and receptor-mediated signaling, is primarily associated with this protein?

A 55-year-old man with a history of haemorrhage and autonomic dysfunction presents with fluctuating blood pressure readings. The attending physician notices a pattern on the monitor that suggests the presence of rhythmic oscillations of blood pressure and uses this clinical finding as a teaching moment to discuss Mayer waves. Which of the following is true regarding these waves in the context of this patient's presentation?

options.label: A
options.text: They represent fluctuations in blood volume within the aorta, affecting systemic circulation.

options.label: B
options.text: They are indicative of rhythmic contractions of the arteries, contributing to peripheral resistance.

options.label: C
options.text: They are a result of reflex bradycardia due to increased intracranial pressure.

options.label: D
options.text: They are indicative of alternate activation of Baroreceptors & Chemoreceptors

questions.correct_answer: D. They are indicative of alternate activation of Baroreceptors & Chemoreceptors
questions.explanation: Ans. D) They are indicative of alternate activation of Baroreceptors & Chemoreceptors

questions.text: What is the mechanism of cough? Forceful expiration against open glottis Expiration against open glottis Deep inspiration against closed glottis Remove harmful substances

A 35-year-old male from a coastal area presents with blood-tinged nasal discharge and nasal stuffiness. On examination, a pink to purple polypoidal mass that bleeds on touch is observed. Which of the following is the most likely causative organism?
A public health researcher is using Chandler’s index to study hookworm infection. Which of the following is NOT a use of Chandler’s index?

options.label: D
options.text: Comparison of worm load in different populations

questions.text: A female patient who is from the north-eastern part of the country came to the hospital with complaints of progressive swelling of the upper limb. She has a history of coronary artery disease for which she underwent percutaneous coronary intervention. On examination, the limbs are more swollen proximally than distally. What is the next best step in the management of this patient?
questions.correct_answer: B. Night blood test for worms
questions.explanation: Ans. B) Night blood test for worms

questions.text: Match the following steps of ventricular action potential in the correct order:
questions.explanation: Ans. C) A-2, B-3, C-4, D-1, E-5

questions.text: A 65-year-old diabetic male presents with severe ear pain and granulations in the ear canal. He has no facial paralysis. Which of the following is the most appropriate initial treatment?
Pasteurization is done at:
25-year-old male presented with head trauma during football game. He has altered consciousness. CT brain shows the following. The next step is:

options.label: B
options.text: Observe and give head high position

questions.text: Which of the following parameters is affected in acute malnutrition?
Identify the procedure leading to the complication shown in image below :

A 30-year-old patient presents with symptoms suggestive of peripheral neuropathy, including slow and impaired nerve conduction. Upon further examination, it is determined that the patient has a demyelinating disorder affecting their peripheral nerves. What specific challenges might arise in managing a condition characterized by demyelination?

options.label: A
options.text: The absence of myelin leads to faster nerve conduction, causing peripheral neuropathy.

options.label: B
options.text: Demyelination allows action potentials to jump between nodes of Ranvier, facilitating Saltatory conduction.

options.label: C
options.text: Myelin insulates nerve fibers, slowing down impulse conduction in demyelinating disorders.

options.label: D
options.text: Demyelinated nerve fibers have a higher lipid content, resulting in faster conduction of impulses.

questions.correct_answer: C. Myelin insulates nerve fibers, slowing down impulse conduction in demyelinating disorders.
questions.explanation: Ans. C) Myelin insulates nerve fibers, slowing down impulse conduction in demyelinating disorders.

questions.text: A 45-year-old woman is concerned about her risk of abdominal fat accumulation and its associated health risks. She measures her waist-hip ratio. What is the cutoff level of waist-hip ratio in women that indicates abdominal fat accumulation?

A 5-months-old child with acute diarrhea is prescribed zinc supplementation as part of the management plan. What is the recommended daily dose of elemental zinc for the treatment of acute diarrhea in this child?
According to European hernia society classification (EHS), hernia labelled as PL2 implies?

options.label: A
options.text: It is caused by multiple organisms

options.label: C
options.text: Surgical treatment is required in most cases

He says that he has been having nocturnal cough for last several weeks. A hemogram revealed elevated eosinophils. Bronchoalveolar lavage (BAL) specimen following bronchoscopy showed the presence of certain larvae as shown in the image below. Identify the causative organism:

On examination, patient was hemodynamically stable but had no palpable lower extremity pulses on the injured side. On exploration - superficial femoral artery was transected. Which of the following is the suture material to be used for vascular repair?

Which of the following helminthic infections that is commonly transmitted by soil, is characterized by the egg in stool as shown in the image below?

A patient with a history of cough for more than 15 days, fever and loss of weight presented to OPD. Sputum culture was advised and the following media was used for inoculation. Identify the culture media?

A patient after a head injury following a road traffic accident. Present with following symptom - He is extremely curious. He forgets everything, hyperorality and increased sex drive. Which of the following structures is most likely to be damaged in this patient?

options.label: A
options.text: Gray matter around aqueduct of Sylvius

questions.text: A 9-months-old child with acute diarrhea with peri oral and peri vaginal rash. Which of the following gene is associated with the condition
Which of the following is considered a “sure sign” of wound dehiscence in a post-operative patient?

options.label: D
options.text: Widening of the abdominal scar with palpable edges

questions.correct_answer: C. Serosanguinous drainage from the wound
questions.explanation: Ans. C) Serosanguinous drainage from the wound

questions.text: A young patient suffered from Blunt trauma to the abdomen and was brought to the Emergency room. He is unstable with a blood pressure of 90/60 mm of Hg. You are the doctor, basic resuscitation is done with Intravenous fluids, FAST is positive. He is not improving despite Intravenous fluids. The next step is?
A 5-year-old child came with fever with rash which was present on the face in the form of slapped cheek appearance. What is the best possible diagnosis?
Identify the condition according to given image:
All of these are causes of bilious vomiting in a neonate at birth except?

A toddler presents with a high fever that suddenly subsides after a few days, followed by the appearance of a characteristic rash consisting of small, pink, raised spots. The fever was accompanied by irritability. Which virus is most commonly associated with this clinical presentation?
questions.correct_answer: D. Roseola infantum virus (Human herpesvirus 6, HHV-6)
questions.explanation: Ans. D) Roseola infantum virus (Human herpesvirus 6, HHV-6)

questions.text: Why hemoglobin cannot pass through the glomerulus in a normal physiological state?

options.label: A
options.text: It is a large molecule bounded with another protein

options.label: B
options.text: It gets attracted to the positive charge of the glomerular filtration barrier

questions.correct_answer: A. It is a large molecule bounded with another protein

questions.text: Which of the following bacteria will survive even after 30 minutes of pasteurization?

A 3-month-old infant presents with inspiratory stridor that worsens when crying and improves when placed in the prone position. On examination, the epiglottis appears omega-shaped and floppy. Which of the following is the most likely diagnosis?
Oxygen sensitive channels in peripheral chemoreceptors are for which of the following ion?

A 45-year female with history of migraine was taking regular NSAIDs. She experienced sudden onset abdominal pain with vomiting. Examination revealed generalized tenderness. X-ray is as shown below. Next step?
Which structures, equivalent to Z-lines in skeletal muscle, are found in smooth muscle cells?
A 30-year-old male presents with sudden choking while eating and is unable to speak or breathe effectively. What is the immediate management for this condition?
A 7-year-old child with acute liver failure was found to have decorticate posturing which is responsive to pain. what is the staging of hepatic encephalopathy?
Beta 2 receptor action leading to hyperglycemia/ hypoglycemia is mediated by which of the following enzymes?
What is the formula to calculate the mid parental height for boys?

A 30-year-old statistician is analyzing a dataset and observes that the mean is less than the median, which in turn is less than the mode. This type of distribution is characteristic of which type of curve?
A 7-year-old child came with GCS 7. Which of the following component is associated with decerebrate posturing?

A 45-year-old teacher presents with hoarseness of voice for the past several months. Laryngoscopy reveals bilateral sessile lesions at the junction of the anterior one-third and posterior two-thirds of the vocal cords. What is the most likely diagnosis?

A cattle rearer presents to the ER with 2-day history of fever, malaise and a painless black eschar on his right forearm. On examination, the eschar is necrotic with surrounding erythema and edema. Culture was done which on gram staining revealed the following finding. Identify the bacteria responsible for the patient’s presentation:

A 10-year-old boy presented to the surgery OPD. On examination, his left scrotal sac is empty and under-developed. On clinical examination the left testis was found in the superficial inguinal pouch. What is the most likely diagnosis?
Cowdry Type A inclusions are seen in?
A 32-year-old female who is a frequent traveller presented with fever and splenomegaly. Peripheral smear shows band across the erythrocytes. What is the causative agent?

A 3-year-old boy is brought to the emergency department with sudden onset of high-grade fever, drooling, and difficulty breathing. On examination, he is sitting in the tripod position with inspiratory stridor. Which of the following is the most likely diagnosis?
A 45-year-old man from Bihar presents with fever, hepatomegaly, splenomegaly. Peripheral smear shown in image. What is the vector for the condition diagnosed by the image shown below?

A 60-year-old male presents with a persistent change in voice for the past three months. He has a history of smoking and alcohol use. Laryngoscopy reveals a lesion on the vocal cords. Biopsy confirms squamous cell carcinoma. Given the early presentation and lesion localization, what is the most likely prognosis and why?

options.label: A
options.text: Good prognosis due to early presentation and low lymphatic spread

options.label: B
options.text: Poor prognosis due to high likelihood of metastasis

options.label: C
options.text: Poor prognosis due to delayed presentation

options.label: D
options.text: Moderate prognosis due to involvement of multiple subsites

questions.correct_answer: A. Good prognosis due to early presentation and low lymphatic spread
questions.explanation: Ans. A) Good prognosis due to early presentation and low lymphatic spread

questions.text: A 45-year-old patient presents with a triad of symptoms including diarrhea, dermatitis, and dementia. Which vitamin deficiency is most likely responsible for these symptoms?

A 60-year-old male with a history of mitral stenosis presents with hoarseness of voice. On examination, there is no evidence of trauma or recent surgery. Which of the following is the most likely cause of his hoarseness?

options.label: A
options.text: Compression of the left recurrent laryngeal nerve

options.label: B
options.text: Compression of the right recurrent laryngeal nerve

options.label: C
options.text: Compression of the internal branch of the superior laryngeal nerve

options.label: D
options.text: Compression of the external branch of the superior laryngeal nerve

questions.correct_answer: A. Compression of the left recurrent laryngeal nerve
questions.explanation: Ans. A) Compression of the left recurrent laryngeal nerve

questions.text: A 4 days old newborn came with abnormal staring look for more than one minute. On further evaluation baby was diagnosed with neonatal seizure. what is the drug of choice in neonatal seizure?
The test kit shown in the image below works on the principle of:
In Modified Radical Neck Dissection (MRND), which of the following structures is not preserved?
A patient presents to the emergency department with unconscious state. An arterial blood analysis is reveals following values:
The graph below shows oxygen dissociation curves. What does the curve marked as red indicate?
questions.explanation:
Ans. A) Myoglobin

Explanation:

  • • Explanation:
  • • The oxygen dissociation curve represents the relationship between oxygen saturation (%) and the partial pressure of oxygen (pO₂ in mmHg) . Different factors shift the curve left or right , indicating changes in oxygen affinity .
  • • oxygen dissociation curve
  • • oxygen saturation (%) and the partial pressure of oxygen (pO₂ in mmHg)
  • • left or right
  • • oxygen affinity
  • • Green Curve (Normal Hemoglobin - HbA) This represents adult hemoglobin (HbA) with a P50 of ~27 mmHg , which means 50% of hemoglobin is saturated at 27 mmHg . Blue Curve (Left Shift - Increased Oxygen Affinity) This represents conditions with increased oxygen affinity , such as fetal hemoglobin (HbF), carboxyhemoglobinemia, or methemoglobinemia . Red Curve (Extremely Left Shifted - Strongest Oxygen Affinity) The P50 of the red curve is ~2 mmHg, meaning it has an extremely high affinity for oxygen and holds onto it very tightly . This behavior is characteristic of myoglobin , which stores oxygen in muscle tissues and releases it only at very low pO₂ levels.
  • • Green Curve (Normal Hemoglobin - HbA) This represents adult hemoglobin (HbA) with a P50 of ~27 mmHg , which means 50% of hemoglobin is saturated at 27 mmHg .
  • • Green Curve (Normal Hemoglobin - HbA)
  • • This represents adult hemoglobin (HbA) with a P50 of ~27 mmHg , which means 50% of hemoglobin is saturated at 27 mmHg .
  • • This represents adult hemoglobin (HbA) with a P50 of ~27 mmHg , which means 50% of hemoglobin is saturated at 27 mmHg .
  • • adult hemoglobin (HbA)
  • • P50 of ~27 mmHg
  • • 50% of hemoglobin is saturated at 27 mmHg
  • • Blue Curve (Left Shift - Increased Oxygen Affinity) This represents conditions with increased oxygen affinity , such as fetal hemoglobin (HbF), carboxyhemoglobinemia, or methemoglobinemia .
  • • Blue Curve (Left Shift - Increased Oxygen Affinity)
  • • This represents conditions with increased oxygen affinity , such as fetal hemoglobin (HbF), carboxyhemoglobinemia, or methemoglobinemia .
  • • This represents conditions with increased oxygen affinity , such as fetal hemoglobin (HbF), carboxyhemoglobinemia, or methemoglobinemia .
  • • increased oxygen affinity
  • • fetal hemoglobin (HbF), carboxyhemoglobinemia, or methemoglobinemia
  • • Red Curve (Extremely Left Shifted - Strongest Oxygen Affinity) The P50 of the red curve is ~2 mmHg, meaning it has an extremely high affinity for oxygen and holds onto it very tightly . This behavior is characteristic of myoglobin , which stores oxygen in muscle tissues and releases it only at very low pO₂ levels.
  • • Red Curve (Extremely Left Shifted - Strongest Oxygen Affinity)
  • • The P50 of the red curve is ~2 mmHg, meaning it has an extremely high affinity for oxygen and holds onto it very tightly . This behavior is characteristic of myoglobin , which stores oxygen in muscle tissues and releases it only at very low pO₂ levels.
  • • The P50 of the red curve is ~2 mmHg, meaning it has an extremely high affinity for oxygen and holds onto it very tightly .
  • • The P50 of the red curve is ~2 mmHg, meaning it has an extremely high affinity for oxygen and holds onto it very tightly
  • • This behavior is characteristic of myoglobin , which stores oxygen in muscle tissues and releases it only at very low pO₂ levels.
  • • myoglobin
  • • stores oxygen in muscle tissues
  • • Other Options :
  • • Other Options :
  • • Option B. Carboxy-hemoglobinemia: Incorrect
  • • Option B. Carboxy-hemoglobinemia: Incorrect
  • • Carboxyhemoglobin (CO-Hb) causes a left shift , but its P50 is much higher than 2 mmHg . CO binds to hemoglobin with 200–250 times greater affinity than oxygen , preventing oxygen release to tissues.
  • • Carboxyhemoglobin (CO-Hb) causes a left shift , but its P50 is much higher than 2 mmHg .
  • • left shift
  • • P50 is much higher than 2 mmHg
  • • CO binds to hemoglobin with 200–250 times greater affinity than oxygen , preventing oxygen release to tissues.
  • • with 200–250 times greater affinity than oxygen
  • • Option C. Methemoglobin: Incorrect
  • • Option C. Methemoglobin: Incorrect
  • • Methemoglobin (MetHb) contains oxidized Fe³⁺, which cannot bind oxygen efficiently . This shifts the curve left but not as drastically as myoglobin .
  • • Methemoglobin (MetHb) contains oxidized Fe³⁺, which cannot bind oxygen efficiently .
  • • oxidized Fe³⁺, which cannot bind oxygen efficiently
  • • This shifts the curve left but not as drastically as myoglobin .
  • • but not as drastically as myoglobin
  • • Option D. Fetal-Hb: Incorrect
  • • Option D. Fetal-Hb: Incorrect
  • • Fetal hemoglobin (HbF) has a higher oxygen affinity than adult hemoglobin (HbA) , shifting the curve left . However, HbF’s P50 is ~19 mmHg, much higher than the P50 of myoglobin (~2 mmHg).
  • • Fetal hemoglobin (HbF) has a higher oxygen affinity than adult hemoglobin (HbA) , shifting the curve left .
  • • higher oxygen affinity than adult hemoglobin (HbA)
  • • left
  • • However, HbF’s P50 is ~19 mmHg, much higher than the P50 of myoglobin (~2 mmHg).
  • • HbF’s P50 is ~19 mmHg, much higher than the P50 of myoglobin (~2 mmHg).

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ The oxygen dissociation curve of myoglobin is extremely left-shifted (P50 = ~2 mmHg), meaning it has a very high affinity for oxygen. Unlike hemoglobin, myoglobin has a hyperbolic dissociation curve and functions as an oxygen storage protein in muscles.
